title: [K-12] Excellence Indicators Exploration for Mobile-Based Elementary Math Instructional Design: Integrated Framework for Fraction/Decimal Operations, Equations, and Probability

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical concepts (operations with fractions/decimals, understanding of basic equations, fundamental probability principles) and mobile device proficiency. Experience with simple formula input, graph interpretation, and statistical data analysis
context.additional_context: A course aimed at strengthening instructional design competencies for elementary math (fractions/decimal operations) in smartphone-based microlearning environments. Learners develop mobile-optimized content and evaluation methods for PC-free settings. Explores creative design strategies including statistics-based problem-solving, proof integration, and probabilistic thinking.

learning_goals: Establishment of a visualization framework for calculations, formulas, problem-solving, and equations in elementary mathematics (fraction/decimal operations) instructional design based on an analysis of 35 excellence indicators of IDT programs in a mobile environment

Identification of five or more technical/educational elements to consider when designing microlearning content using smartphones (e.g., implementation of interactive graphs, step-by-step problem-solving support, real-time feedback systems, probabilistic problem-solving scenarios, and statistics-based analysis tools)

Learners must develop one prototype of a mobile device-optimized (tablet/smartphone) instructional design for elementary mathematics (fraction/decimal operations) within one week per team (3â€“4 members) and achieve 4+ points (5-point scale) in two out of three peer evaluation rubric items (content suitability, technical implementation, creativity). The prototype must include equation visualization, probabilistic problem-solving elements, and statistical analysis functions

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
